result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Blank was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/School or combination of the two.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
No objection to transfer probation
Possible right to expungement upon successful completion of probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L Blank

Ct 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>D&RI
COURT GRANTS

PLEA: 
Ct 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis;
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.

COURT defers matter for a period of 30 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND to Possession of controlled substance 961.41 (3g)(d)

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s):  R.M., R.J. or S.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No controlled substances.  Absolute sobriety.    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 with day reporting - STAYED for 35 day treatment program at Tomah VA.
